title: Veken Coffee Grinder Electric Spice & Nut Grinder with Stainless Steel Blade, Detachable Power Cord Coffee Bean Grinder for Coffee Grounds, Grains, 12 Cups (White)
features:

EFFICIENT GRIND- The grinder motor is quite powerful when revving, doing a great job to chop up your coffee beans into grounds in just a few seconds. Also, it works amazingly well grinding up other fairly hard materials with ease.

PERFECT SIZE- Compact design takes minimum space and can be stored easily. It can fit nicely for your counter, cupboard and drawer. Despite its small size, 50g grinding capacity yields up to 12 cups of coffee which is enough for your family and friends to share.

USER-FRIENDLY DESIGN- The fully-embedded cover prevents coffee grounds from spilling out and the top is clear so you can see what is going on in the grinder. The power cord can be detached when not in use. Low noise motor will not disturb your family while you prepare their morning cup.

MULTIPLE USES - Not just grinding coffee bean, our grinder can also grind spices, nuts, herbs, pepper, seeds, grains and more! The grinder can grind coffee bean perfectly consistent for french press, espresso, turkish or drip coffee.
2-YEAR WARRANTY- Enjoy a 2-year product warranty and lifetime customer support from the manufacturer. If you find any problems or defects with your purchase, it will be replaced, free of charge.

reviews.reviewText: LOVE this little machine! I got it to grind flax seeds and chia seeds. Will probably use it to chop nuts as well. It is awesome! Best part is that it cleans out so easily!!

I was so impressed with this machine by reading all the good reviews on Amazon website, so I am excited to get me one. But when I got it, it disappointed me so much. It’s nothing like the reviews online I read .... 😥😥😥 I hate to write the bad review but I think I have to WARN other people so they don’t step in the path which I just did. The bowl is very small. The electronic cord is not stay firmly. It work on and off. I am so frustrated to use this small machine.

It’s a nice size for making coffee every day- and I love that it’s white. The white Looks nicer sitting on the counter.
Seems to be made well, and easy to clean.

reviews.reviewTitle: An excellent coffee grinder, a big bang for the buck!
reviews.reviewText: After slogging through the various coffee grinders available, I settled on this one from Veken. Why? The first is the attractive price. The second, it is a very good grinder. It is easy to load with beans, grinds the coffee, and the simple instructions on how to get just the right style of ground bean is as simple as it can get. With the included cleaning brush it is a breeze to clean. The added bonus; freshly ground beans have a better flavor. So if you have been hesitating about buying "whole bean coffee beans" because you don't want to spend a lot on a grinder and confused about which one to buy, take it from me, you won't go wrong with this one. It really is a "big bang for the buck."

Been using for a few weeks. Toss in some beans, turn it on, count to 8, turn it off. Dump out the grounds. It's that simple. It comes with a small brush that works great for getting the sticky grounds out from around the blade and cup.

At first it seemed kind of loud, but what doesn't sound loud at 4am? My apartment neighbor hasn't complained so...

It's fairly consistent. I haven't sent the grounds off to be tested, but my coffee always tastes great and the amount of sediment on the bottom of my coffee cup seems consistent as well.

The only thing I can't attest to is durability. It seems sturdy enough, but only time will tell. If it lasts a year, I'll consider that a win, it did cost just under $20 after all. If it doesn't, I'll post a follow up.

My husband has become obsessed with cold brew, so I got him a home brew system and it requires a course ground bean (impossible to find around here in-store). The grinder is compact and doesn’t take up a lot of space in the closet, but I wish it was a little larger as we do have to run 4 cupfuls of beans to get the amount needed for a full batch (in a 2 quart brew jar) but it only takes 5 seconds to get the course grind.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, slightly hard to clean
reviews.reviewText:
Grinder is very easy to use, plug it in and it immediately works. It grinds well and you can get the beans quite fine if you want them to be (I do).

Cleaning is a little difficult as detaching the blade is a lot of work and there is not really a way to safely wash the grinder bowl itself, so you have to use either a brush they provide or a cloth. For that reason, I don't plan on using this for anything but coffee. However, if you intend to just use this for grinding coffee, this little grinder is perfect.

I only bought this for coffee and I really like it. I looked at several different types of grinders, but did not want to spend the money on the fancy Burr type ones. I liked the reviews for this one and the size. There are no full beans left in the grinder when I use it, unlike my old black and decker one. Overall a great product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Veken Coffee Grinder Electric Spice & Nut Grinder is junk
reviews.reviewText: Add appears you can remove the stainless bowl for easy cleaning but you can't. Misleading add. Probably will return it.

As others have mentioned this grinder is mighty and efficient. Grind quality excellent for either drip coffee maker or French press. Be aware not that it takes away from quality, capacity space to grind coffee beans is much smaller than Bodum and grinders I've used. In the past.
The grinder can be a little messy due to the small circular space on the lid. However Velken is kind enough to include a small brush with grinder for clean up which much better than a separate brush I purchased previously. Plus the grinder is a great space saver for countertops.
We love this grinder! It’s easy to use, easy to clean, and the perfect grind each time.

reviews.reviewTitle: Don't buy this product. Terrible Machine
reviews.reviewText: Whenever you pop the lid off, coffee grind go flying every time. It's a ridiculous design that leaves coffee grind residue all over the lip of the base unit making it difficult to put the top back on without getting coffee grinds all over the place. Who on Earth designed this and let it out of the factory. Don't waste your money.

Update: I needed a new coffee grinder for our trailer and for me to take to the office and I just ordered this one again, just in black. The blades on this one are just as sharp as the first one. This one didn't come with a brush, I'm guessing it was just not put in the box, but I ended up buying a small cheap paint brush that does work a lot better than the brush the first one came with. I'm able to grind beans to either fine or coarse for my espresso maker. Just like the first, this little machine packs a punch. Easy to clean and easy to store. I don't regret buying the same one and the first one is still going 5 months later.
This grinder is really easy to use. What I like about it is I can either do a coarse or fine grind. The fine does take a little longer. As you can hear in the video, it does make noise but its not that loud. When it comes to cleaning, it is really easy to clean. It did come with a brush, but I found it took a little longer to clean. I bought a small cheap paint brush and it makes cleaning it a lot easier. I do hand wash the lid though. I do keep this on my counters because it hardly takes up space.
To think I almost bought an expensive Vitamix just to grind my annato seeds. This gem did the job within seconds and it cost me less than $20. I love it.
Blade came loose after 2 weeks of use. Blade is scraping the inside (see pictures). Horrible noise when using. Totally useless now.
This product is in no name brand. It didn't look to be well made and was from an unknown manufacturer.

I received this coffee grinder on March 4th. I grind coffee and flax seed with it. I do not do it every day. Today May 8 th it is not working. The top does not go on and the button will not go down. I cannot recommend this coffee grinder.
This is a good quality product and grinds my coffee to the consistency I want. It is noisy much like other grinders which is to be expected. It’s small size makes it easy to store.

It is advertised as a compact design, but it seems to be pretty standard from past experiences and shopping around. Noise-wise it seems to be slightly quieter than average. The cup for grinding the beans/whatever else seems a little on the small side, and the cup does not come out which makes it a little harder to clean. A brush is provided but with the blade it can be a little hard to brush all the debris out; I'd probably recommend one that has a detachable cup so you can hand wash/rinse out under running water. The lid does seem great on this one and I have not had any issues with grounds flying out.

reviews.reviewTitle: So easy to use and easy to clean
reviews.reviewText: I love waking up in the morning for my nice warm cup of coffee and having 10 to 15 minutes for the kids wake up. I guess you could say I’m a coffee lover and I am addicted. There’s a lot of times when I buy whole bean coffee and I need to grind them are use manual ones in the past and it takes forever that’s why I was so excited to find this coffee grinder that’s electric. It takes up very little space and is easy to use. This is easy to clean. And it allows me to have my cuppa coffee daily. I love waking up in the morning for my nice warm cup of coffee and having 10 to 15 minutes for the kids wake up. I guess you could say I’m a coffee lover and I am addicted. There’s a lot of times when I buy whole bean coffee and I need to grind them are use manual ones in the past and it takes forever that’s why I was so excited to find this coffee grinder that’s electric. It takes up very little space and is easy to use. This is easy to clean. And it allows me to have my cuppa coffee daily.

You can wipe it and it comes with a brush but because you can't get it wet of remove the blade can't get it totally clean. I'm just grinding flax seeds so it no biggie, I just blow into it after use. Works well and super easy to use

I really like this grinder. I mean, it is supposed to be used for coffee beans...but I also used it to grind spices (do at your own risk!!!) and it grounded my star anise just fine. Lol. At this rate, if it breaks fast, it would be my fault. As of now, it is working great for me and I use it at least twice a week—more if I drink coffee everyday. I like how it easily detaches for a quick and easy clean up. I don’t know if anyone has issues with this product but for me it is working good!

Sorry, this video is unsupported on this browser.
 Completely useless unless you are making a half a pot at a time. Its very loud!. Takes a long time to grind. After finding, you have to use brush. Which is nice they include. The screw holes catch everything. Almost impossible to clean the screw holes. Should of taken the hint when the company 's video only showing about 6 pepper corn seeds being ground. Avoid. There are a lot of better products out there.

Sorry, this video is unsupported on this browser.
 I actually bought this to use for grinding nuts for cooking and baking and oatmeal and other stuff for making beauty products. In the video, I ground oatmeal and dried chamomile. As you can see, the grinder had them completely ground in just a couple of seconds. I haven't used it for coffee, but it's fairly obvious that it would have no trouble with coffee beans. I'm very pleased with this grinder.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good grinder, but not for coffee
reviews.reviewText:
First off, it’s not a 12 cup grinder. The directions say something like if you grind your own beans it will make 12 cups. If you’re a coffee snob and weigh your beans, this grinds 6 cups worth (about 50g).

Aside from that, does a good job grinding and is quite sturdy.
This grinder broke before I even used it for the first time. Not worth the money.

I have been looking for a great coffee bean grinder for a long time. I have tried several and they are either too small or too big and take up way too much cabinet space. This grinder is perfect. It grinds the beans up to perfection - not leaving small chunks. It is super easy to clean. And it looks nice if I decide to leave it sitting out for the day.

This thing grinds everything up in seconds. Very easy to operate.

They give you a brush to clean it but the blades don’t remove without opening up the bottom so it’s not super easy to clean but it’s a great grinder!

reviews.reviewTitle: No fine ground and Fire station horn in my kitchen
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to like this but over time it’s not happening. First, it doesn’t finely ground coffee, even if I let it run for a while. Secondly, it’s loud as crazy. Think fire station horn. Yes, loud. Not a nice way to start the morning with a blowhorn giving me a headache before I can have coffee. I gave it 2 stars bc it does grind. It’s just not for me. Prob will go in the trash and I’ll buy another. I’ve had it passed the return date. It was supposed to replace my prior grinder.

Great for the price! I had a Mr. Coffee grinder that was $40. But it was jor grinding espresso quality like it needed to. This one does so far, although I've only used it twice. Easy to use and easier to clean as well. I would recommend not filling any more than half for espresso because the fine grounds stick to the side of the vial due to the centrifugal force. A little loud, but that comes with an electric grinder I suppose. Overall, was a great purchase!

reviews.reviewTitle: Worked alright for a few months
reviews.reviewText:
Difficult to make a consistent grind but it more or less worked fine for a few months before it started running without its lid on. Today I placed my beans in, it started on its own, threw beans in a 4 foot radius, then never ran again.
As for cleaning I never put in water and brushed it after every use, and close inspection of the switch revealed no coffee inside to account for the autonomous running prior and at it's death. I probably used it to grind 10-20g of coffee 150-300 times before it broke, so maybe you are better off spending your money on a different brand or a manual burr grinder.

Great grinder. Very fast and efficient. As a blade grinder it will always be louder than a spiral grinder. This one is not bad at all.
But..its really fast and produces the perfect ground coffee in less than 60 seconds. Perfect!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Veken Coffee Grinder Electric Spice & Nut Grinder
reviews.reviewText: Arrived quickly. Wow, I am so impressed with the speed of grinding nuts. I needed some Almond flour, put the almonds in, pushed the button, WHIZZZZZ and I had what I needed in a few seconds. Included is a brush to clean out the metal cup.

I brought this for coffee we love the beans, makes a better tasting coffee and we had a grinder that was very old and decide to find a new grinder that did the job like the old one. I have to say that this grinder is remarkable with grinding the coffee beans. Very easy to use and if you hold the button down to long you get espresso coffee ,easy to clean and it holds an adequate amount of beans.. small and compact for my kitchen counter.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great, design is a little lacking
reviews.reviewText:
Better than I expected. I am not sure what I was expecting as far as the inner cup that holds the coffee beans because you can't take it out to clean it and it's rather tricky emptying the grounded coffee unless you empty into a bigger bowl and that just makes more stuff to wash. Just seems like it could have been designed a bit more user friendly. But it works great. I mean it's liketee split and you are finished grinding the beans befor you realize it.
I am happy with it and I did purchase a good well made product (thus far) which is always my concern when buying electric products online. Just the design could have been better designed. But I do recommend this product.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee tastes and smells are superior to pre-ground coffee
reviews.reviewText:
The yield is enough to do 12 cups for sure. We make a 4 cup pot on a smaller Mr. Coffee and it is great for one person.

This relatively inexpensive coffee bean grinder is just what we wanted. Only drawback is the size; if you are looking to grind more than a few ounces. We found that our coffee (Columbian from 7-11) was being sold as whole bean many times when ground was not available; so we got a Veken for an inexpensive way to assure we could have coffee beans ground as well.

Works perfectly. Super loud so if you are looking for something quiet, this is not it. I only use it for coffee and it is very easy to clean and comes with an added brush i don't even have to use. A nice swipe of a towel gets the job done. The blade does get in the way of cleaning but no big deal. Worth every dollar.

I bought it because I went to my friend house and she make very strong cup of coffee that it taste different than any another coffee I ever had it’s very delicious and strong and it smelled great. It just you can grind for just two cops and every time you have a fresh cup of coffee that’s amazing right it’s very easy to clean And also easy to use.
it's only suited for coffee. you advertise that it chops nuts, but it pulverized walnuts into a paste with just a couple of pushes. we'll be returning this and looking for an actual nut chopper.

i bought this in April - its August now & it doesnt work anymore. So it lasted for 4 months. There says there's a guarantee for 2 years - but there's no way to reach the company. I am disappointed in this.

reviews.reviewTitle: Arrived damaged but works well. Good price
reviews.reviewText: I've only used a couple of times but seems to work well. It came with the lid cracked despite the box being in great shape. The crack doesn't seem to be causing any issue with it working and I didnt want to wait on a replacement so I decided to keep it especially since it was so cheap.

have gone through many brands and varieties of spice grinders. And I found all of them deficient. Too small and lacking in power. Having several parts that need to be assembled in order to use. I found this grinder to be the best of the lot. Sleek and powerful and easy to clean, it easily grinds coriander seed, which I’ve found present a problem for most spice grinders.

reviews.reviewTitle: Now that I know it is for grinding coffee beans . . .
reviews.reviewText: Growing up, my brother had one. Never occurred to me that this was for coffee. Imagine my surprise! I use it to grind my coffee at least a few times a week. I often add cinnamon sticks or other things to make my own naturally flavored coffee combinations. I have no complaints. Very easy to control the size of the grind if you are like me and vacillate between a French press, percolator and good old drip coffee maker.

I am using this to grind coffee beans and it works great, I am able to get them ground just how I like them. It is not any more or less noisy than any other electric grinder I have used. Clean up is easy and it is compact enough you can tuck it away on the counter and it looks nice. I would definitely recommend it!

I wanted a second grinder to use for spices and such and this is the perfect size. It works well for coffee as you see in the video but the container is a little small to grind a full pot of coffee grinds. Splitting it in two works fine. Nice piece
We only need to use this on the weekends, so it does the job. I probably would by a much larger one if I used it every day. It does grind nice and is small for storing.

Nice little coffee grinder. Easy to use. Wish the coffee bowl was removable from the grinder. Description Says it will grind enough beans for 12 cups of coffee - maybe is you like weak coffee. Based on the MAX fill line, I am only able to grind enough beans to make 6 or 7 cups.
I'm not happy with this and will give it away to someone in the family. I bought this for my vacation home but it is not a good as the Hamilton Beach Fresh Grind Coffee Grinder (80335R)

This is my first time diving into grinding up my own coffee beans so I was looking for simple and effective. This product was perfect. Since I don't have a lot of space currently, I needed something small and this little machine hardly takes up any space. Easy to clean as well. I'm pretty sure this will last me quite a while, unless I do something catastrophic like drop it. Glad I made the mistake of buying coffee beans instead of the kind I normally do.
A great little office coffee grinder. It’s easy to clean, doesn’t make large amounts, just enough and is rather quiet.

This is a recent purchase for me. My intended use is for coffee and spices. So far I have only used it for coffee and it has worked great. It does get a little warm, but that is expected. My use of this grinder has been recent so my ratings and review are a little pre-mature. However, so far I'm very happy with it.

We use this to freshly grind coffee beans for our French press and have been happy with the results. Very easy to use. Small and easy to store when not in use. Coffee settles into grooves where the screws are in the bottom of the grinder and it’s a little tough to clear out even with the brush they give you...that would be my only complaint if there was any but it’s definitely not a deal breaker

Strong grind but a little louder than I thought it’d be. Guess that’s because of its power during the grind. It’s not as easy to clean because you can’t use anything wet.. but overall I’m happy with this product- we grind things like coffee, flax seeds and chia seeds

I just received this and used it twice. I had a Braun for over 20 years, this looks like cheap plastic that might last 1-2 years. Buy quality, it is always worth it. I have low hopes for this one and no I will not buy 2 year warranty. If this product didn't perform well for 2 years then why buy a warranty?

now you can buy coffee beans and grind them at home, its a first for me and i like it, so i can have freshly ground coffee, and it does the job pretty well. and its easy to clean, just keep that bush handy or have a general place to know where to keep it.
This broke the second use! The little spring popped out of the power button

These worked so good for the nuts I wanted crushed! Making a crust for a pie and needed my walnuts and almonds grinded and this helped so much. The brush it came with also made it easy to clean as well. This was a great product for making nut pie crusts
This is very small coffee grinder. It is very loud.

The detachable power cord is located in a very awkward spot on the coffee grinder. If it’s stored on a counter top, the mfg. name is off to the side, and the actuator is on the back side. Is this going to wreck my day?...no, it was a great price, and grinds coffee real well. I hope it lasts longer than my “Mr Coffee” grinder.
I use this to grind up egg shells for my dog. I make his dog food. I add ground up shells for calcium for him. I was using a mortar and pestal but couldn't get it fine enough. This does the job well.

I love coffee, and fresh ground coffee is the best! This grinder is fast and easy to clean. I use it every day and have great tasting coffee! I have to grind twice because its for a smaller coffee pot than what I have, but that is ok.

I used the grinder for the first time this morning. Easy to plug in and use. Ground the coffee beans into a fine consistency. So far so good. I’ll update my review after a few more uses.

Not as easy to clean after use.

I ordered this product and the Veken French Press together. They've become the bright-spot of our morning routine in the office. They're so easy to use even my boss figured it out and often has a new brew going before any of the rest of us make it in in the morning. I highly recommend this to anyone wanting to branch out into grinding and new at-home brewing methods.

I just had this delivered. I had been thinking about purchasing a coffee grinder so when I saw this on the lighting deal I decided to try it. I have only done a quick test grind to see how it worked. It worked great for the test. Much faster than I expected. It is also a great compact size.
I have used it twice since purshe 10 days ago and it seems to be what it promises. However would like to get a larger print copy of the instructions since I am visually handicapped.

reviews.reviewTitle: I'm enjoying real delicious coffee right now.
reviews.reviewText: Its surprising how the little package is so correct. FIILL beams to max and that's 12 cups. I must pay attention to grinding time I think about 10 sec. Just about made espresso powder. The unit is quiet and not much bigger then my coffee cup.
I use it for different reasons than only grinding coffee. I used it to grind dandelion roots and other herbs. Excellent so far.

We drink lots of coffee around here. Someone shared that the coffee would be fresher if we would grind it ourselves. They were right. I also use it to grind herbs into a fine powder. Works great for that too.

Using this with just normal daily use, nothing abusive, just standard grinding for morning coffee. This didn't hold up too well. The plastic trigger after a while would just fall out. Yeah we could put it back in, but it became a pain to put back in..not hard, just not needed as a usage step :(
I wouldn't recommend this to anyone, as they will ultimately probably have issues.
That said, when it worked, it worked well, just needed a little more care than simple daily use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice addition to my kitchen utensils!
reviews.reviewText: I LIKE EVERYTHING IN THIS ITEM, I ALREADY USED IT TO GRIND MULTI COLORED PEPPERS FOR COOKING, WORKED OUTSTANDING! NICE AND CONVENIENT DEVISE! PERFECT FOR EVERY DAY USE. THE CUTE SMALL BRUSH DOES ITS WORK BRILLIANTLY!

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use but some minor negatives
reviews.reviewText: Very easy to use. Takes a little longer than usual to grind the beans, the inside isnt removable so it's annoying to pour out the coffee from the machine itself and annoying to clean. But it's a solid piece and very easy to use
I got this cause I recently really got into the coffee brewing hobby. Really useful to grind up the beans and I've only had it for a little while, but it's working well!
Game changing! I was trying to use a manual grinder with little success, but this does a perfect job. It is so easy to clean and use, plus it works very quickly.

Bought to try grinding my own coffee beans. This little powerhouse is quick and efficient. Easy to clean, easy to use. Appropriate amount of noise. Grind is finer than store bought coffee. Husband loves his coffee !!

This little powerful coffee grinder does it all. I have been using this coffee grinder daily and it gives you a great cup of coffee. What a pleasant surprise.All it takes is 15 seconds to grind. Very easy to clean.
Veken your grinder is a winner

It grinds up beans very quickly and smoothly. Easy to clean especially with the little brush that comes with it. Kinda loud, but I suppose I'd expect that from a coffee grinder. 10/10 would buy again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good for spice grinding in small amounts.
reviews.reviewText: It’s an efficient grinder for spices. The holding cup is a bit small. It comes with a nice brush for getting all the ground powder out & seems to have a strong motor.

Good price, and good product~
a little bit sticky when my coffee beans too greasy.
Overall~~ recommend !!!!
just remind this product can make no more than 27 grams beans everytime.~ Basically 16- 18oz coffee~
Well made and clean lines. The unit was purchased for daily grinding of coffee for a 12 cup pot. The unit requires two fills for 12 cups of coffee. As such, I would not purchase again.
Happy with my purchase. I have been using it non stop. It grinds my coffee to whatever consistency I like. It's simple, straight to the point. And doesn't take up much counter space.
Worked well for 5 months, then suddenly stopped working. Tried it in several different outlets. Just didn't work today, can't tell why.

Like any blade grinder, the grind is a little inconsistent unless ground really fine, but other than that it's perfect! I've had it for over a month, I use it just about every day, and it still works like new!
The only thing I don't like is the lid just sets on top, it doesn't click into place before you turn it on or while it's running. Otherwise it's perfect.
This unit works fantastic. The grinder at Costco was not working correctly and it did not grind to expresso grounds. I bought this model and solved the problem.

Not a well thought out design on this product. Works well for nuts & spices, but is very poor for coffee. Can't use the cover to transfer ground or unground coffee beans. Means you have to use another utensil. Probably OK for grinding spices or nuts, but not for coffee on a daily basis.

This thing is tiny, it barely makes enough coffee grinds for a regular french press, so you have to overfill it. Tried grinding almonds in it, didn't work too well, was very chunky. Blender does a better job
I am very pleased with this product. Small, which is what I wanted. Works very well and not crazy loud. Simple design. Happy with purchase. Would recommend to anyone.
Easy to use. Followed instructions and 30 seconds later perfect ground coffee beans. Not very quiet but no nosier than any other grinder I have used. Good quality and works good.
I use this grinder almost daily. It works very well. Home brewed coffee tastes SO much better with freshly ground beans. Highly reccomend!
Bought to grind apricot seeds and others. Worked great with no mess or fuss. Clean up is a breeze unlike other grinders I've had in the past. Love it! Will recommend to others.

I bought this specifically and exclusively to grind my dried Cayenne, Habs, Reapers and Scorps. Turns peppers into power in no time at all. I have another one that cost almost 3 times this much, and it doesn't do nearly as well. No negatives (so far).
I've owned much more expensive grinders and this one is great! I bought it to use as a spice grinder since I buy a lot of spices in bulk. Glad I found this!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works Really Good! Wish The Cup Size Was A Little Larger!
reviews.reviewText:
Love it!! It does the Dog food pellets besides coffee.
Only wish the cup size was a little larger
Recommend!
Judy M.
I am using this to grind spices. It does well with cloves and cardamom seeds. It is a little tougher with cinnamon sticks, but it gets it done.
I love this thing!!! So easy to keep clean and definitely does the job super well! Love how compact it is. Sits neatly tucked away in my cupboard.
Very well made, not flimsy at all this little item is Going to save me money by allowing me to grind up my own coffee beans. Worth every penny.
I use this to grind up calcium supplements for my dogs. I don't know how it works for coffee but it will grind these huge calcium pills into a fine powder.
Simple grinder that grinds the beans but does not provide consistency. Easy to use and easy to clean up.
This thing is great! With-in a couple seconds touch have ground coffee to brew right up. Greats a nice fine grind which I like for making cold brew coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Tiny capacity bowl and hard to clean
reviews.reviewText:

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to clean, works very well, great price point.
reviews.reviewText: I've had this little grinder for about 2 months now and it works great. I was spending a ton of money every week buying iced coffees from DD Sun-Sat, and realized I could save money by brewing my own at home, at least during the work week. As I love Dunkin coffee, I grabbed a bunch of their whole bean coffee bags and purchased this grinder. The coffee really does taste better when freshly ground, and smoother when cold brewed in the fridge! I follow the instructions - only fill with beans 3/4 of the way - and with a few short pulses, I get the coarse-ground coffee required for my Kitchenaid 72 fl oz cold brewer, though I do have to grind several batches to get the 8 oz needed for a full pot. The grinding compartment is easy to clean with the cute little brush. Great price point and happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: Very frustrated with this Grinder - when we received it - they did not include the blade that sits in the grinder and actually grinds up the coffee. We returned it and they issued us a refund. But frustrated with the process.

Product as described. The ability to grind and chop up coffee or herbs well and fast. Doesn't take much just a few pushes of one button no looking around trying to make sure it's turned on or accidentally pressing the button turning it on and cut your fingers case the lid has to be on in order for it to work.the noise from it will wake your roommate or family but over all not as bad as I thought it be but if was possible be less loud would be great. Loved the design of it except for lid not keeping smaller ground up pieces inside of it goes up around the lip of the lid. Have to plus to keep from not doing that.

Main purpose for this purchase was - we are grinding the green coffee beans (part of our keto diet).
Those beans are very hard.
I've burned couple of previous grinders, even more expensive ones.
So I was looking for powerful yet inexpensive device.
Very satisfied with this one. So far works great (using it few months now).
Simple. Easy to use and to clean.
For harder staff (like green beans) - it's important not to overheat the engine, so making it in chunks of 20 sec maximum. 20 sec - more than enough. For full load of regular roasted coffee - 10 sec is good.
I recommend that grinder.

I grind beans every couple of days, I make coffee for myself, and occasionally I share with neighbors. I'm not picky as to the relative fineness of the grind. Generally, I'm happy with a tasty cup of coffee. I also "adulterate" my coffee with soy milk, heated and whipped into a froth. I love it that way. I don't have many times when I'm drinking straight black coffee. But when I do, I like it. Not bitter.

I have washed the lid and the blade tub in the dishwasher and it was perfect! I don't like the system for storing the cord, it makes putting it a way a little bit fussy, but I can imagine many would like it. My dislike is more due to my wanting to just put it away quickly, no fault of the design.

I have been shopping for an electric grinder to supplement my manual burr grinder. The Veken grinder presented 'front & center', I read some of the reviews and clicked, Buy Now. The unit was bigger than I thought it would be, more substantial. Which is a good thing, feels like quality. It grinds coffee, quickly, without a tired arm. My first use produced a fine grind after a solid 15 second spin. A lot of the coffee was stuck to the inside of the chamber. Today I used a series of pulses with much better results. No grounds had stuck to the inside of the chamber. Also the grind was a little less fine, better for a drip machine than powdery coffee. The outer texture is a nice touch, and the removable cord is fantastic. Very pleased.

Customer support is great. They contacted me the minute I received the product. They guarantee their product. I tested it. It’s great. I like the white color, the size and the cord being detacheable. It’s CUTE The only thing I would wish is that - it can grind more than the amount its suppose to grind. You have to grind multiple times to make more than 2 cups of coffee .. .....depending on how you strong you want. I prefer strong coffee and drinks 2-3 cups a day, at least. It’s small as indicated. I like the versatility that you can grind not just coffee beans. It’s perfect in my kitchen and can easily be stored. Since I have not tested it long enough in my kitchen, I can’t say much about its durability. But I am covered with warranty if ever it fails. Perfect for my own use.

reviews.reviewTitle: No expert, but this is a great grinder
reviews.reviewText: I'm not a coffee expert, but this grinder did everything it was supposed to do correctly. I was looking for a good grinder that I could use in my Keurig and french press. I heard horror stories about the beans coming out inconsistent. Needless to say, there was a perfect consistency with this grinder when i used grinding techniques for both types of brews. This grinder did not overheat while grinding the coffee beans. It even operated somewhat quietly. Cleaning the grinder was not troublesome at all. There is no need to invest in one of those super fancy expensive grinders. For a person who just wants to have yummy coffee with little hassel, this would be your go to product.

After our ten year anniversary trip to Italy my husband became an espresso lover. We had invested in an espresso machine awhile back but had never had a place to set it up or time to figure out how to use it. With a newfound love of espresso we set out to figure out how to use it. We found that how finely ground the coffee is was very important. By grinding our own coffee beans it allows us to have much better control as well as a gives us a much larger variety of flavors and types of coffee. The Veken coffee grinder is incredibly easy to use, simple to figure out and a great size. It’s not so big that it takes up to much space but big enough to grind a good amount of coffee at one time. We couldn’t be happier.

This is my first coffee grinder. It was more economical to buy a bag of coffee beans and grind up for mine and my husband's daily coffee habit. I look the sleek look of this one and that's its small and won't take up much space. I was really surprised by how powerful it was since it was small but it ground those coffee beans up in no time! Very easy to clean as well!

I wasn't sure if I needed a new coffee grinder until I got this one! There are not small particles left after I grind those beans for just 10 to 15 seconds! Just arrived yesterday, and maybe I"m writing this review too early, but so far I LOVE IT! (I was concerned at first because the package was really damaged.. so much damaged that I could see the grinder through the mailing package and the box it was packed in at the girnder factory! But it works so the damage does not seem to have hurt it)

We enjoy fresh ground coffee in the mornings and oour old grinder finally gave out after many years of service. We researched a replacement and chose the Veken. The price was very good and the delivery exceptional. It was delivered on Memorial Day and ordered only two days prior. It took a few tries but have discovered the best method. Initially, I timed the grind at 30 seconds and though it performed very well, it actually burned the coffee a bit. Now I grind the beans for 20 seconds straight and then two additional 5 second bursts. Works great and coffee tastes wonderful. It is a very powerful little machine but still new. Hopefully, it will last for several years.

I want to like this coffee grinder since it does the job of grinding the beans and isn't too bulky, but the coffee grounds always manages to stick to the sides - and it's a significant amount too. If I don't scrape the sides after each grind, I won't have nearly enough to make my coffee. The reservoir is also too small to make sizable batches of ground coffee. This grinder does the job, but comes with a significant amount of frustration.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to put together and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder was easy to put together. I’m still learning the grinding time to get the right coffee ground size, but this is easy to use. All you have to do is press down on a button to get it started. You release once you’re done. I suggest pulsing it a little so it doesn’t burn out the grinder. So far, there aren’t any burnt smells or anything. It comes with a little brush to help clean out the grinder as well. It’s a nice product that’s convenient to use.

Out of the blue, my last grinder died. I had enough ground coffee to get me through until today, so I quickly got online to see what I could find on Amazon. I didn't want to spend a lot, and this fit the bill. I had a $5 coupon. Came quickly via prime, and I immediately took it out to grind coffee for my next cold brew. This is so much quieter than the previous grinder, which is great for my skittish cats. Cleaned up easily. The well is deeper than my last grinder, which I also like. This is a great deal at this price and just what I wanted.

I have been using this product mostly to grind up spices like whole clove. While it does a decent job for the most part I regularly find larger chunks within the mixture that have to be picked out and ground up again even after grinding for a minute or longer. I do really like that the base is metal instead of plastic as it makes cleaning the device much easier and it isn't as loud as the last grinder I had. I can't say how well it will do with coffee beans though as I have not yet tried that.

Nice compact counter footprint. Wish the grinder unit detached from the device for cleaning like my old one did. You have to detach the cord and then wash. Also wish the cord wrapped or could store inside the grinder. Although the length is longer than most, it's annoying, at least to me, to have to wrap it up or hide it somewhere in between use. This was a Black Friday special item and I let my shopping emotions get the best of me for a low-priced deal!

I recently got into making my own cold brew coffee, and using fresh beans and a coarse grind is an absolute must. My previous grinder would over grind the beans to a powder and was a no go for cold brew. I picked up this grinder and for the past few batches of beans I've been really satisfied (about 5 seconds grind time). Really happy with this and would purchase again in the future.

Seems sturdy and well-made. Not overly noisy. The blade spins very fast, and it grinds almost too quickly to fine consistency. So, it's taking me a little practice to get the grind right. One nitpick: the grounds tend to cling to the sides, making it a little tedious to get all of the grinds out. Other grinders have had the same issue, so not unique or a deal breaker.

Ok first off I haven't tried this with coffee beans. I got it grind dry spicies. It demolished cloves, garlic and pepper corns! It makes a very consistent powder, doesn't leave little chunks. This grinder holds a lot more then the little one I replaced it for. It isn't very nosey but still makes noise grinding. It was simple to clean and no powder gets left under the blade.

This works so well! I took a picture next to your standard peanut butter jar to show size. It’s nice and compact. Perfect for the person who wants to grind their coffee fresh each morning. A quick 5-10 seconds for my French press and it was ready to go. After grinding, it was easy to clean. The coffee brewed nicely and tasted great. I am so happy with this and wish I could give it more than 5 stars!

This small but mighty coffee bean grinder is a star in my kitchen. I took a chance on a brand I was not familiar with and scored a win. It’s an excellent grinder and is powerful enough for the job. I would caution you to check the volume of beans you need for your coffee maker. It’s perfect for my Quisinart 12 cup using Starbucks beans, but if you need a larger amount of beans you’ll have to grind two or more batches.

reviews.reviewTitle: Plastic switch on grinder lid broke
reviews.reviewText: I have had this grinder for four months. Worked pretty good until the plastic switch on the lid of the grinder, which operates the grinder, broke off. Seems to be made a very cheap materials, probably from China. I hope the company will respond to this review because they claim they have a warranty. I have already tried to contact them but they have not contacted me back. Not the best customer service.

reviews.reviewTitle: Useful for anyone interested in grinding their own coffee
reviews.reviewText: I use this about twice a week to make cold brew. It takes no time at all and can get the needed coarseness. It obviously doesn't hold a lot of beans so for anyone making larger batches of coffee, I wouldn't suggest this. However, for most people, it's perfect! Also, my only issue is that it can be a pain to clean as grounds can get in the screw tops inside the grinding area.

Been using this since February. Excellent appliance, no complaints. We use this to grind whole beans for our French press.

I like that the cord unplugs for easy storage, easy one button operation, and the little brush it comes with to sweep out grounds is useful.

A bit loud but I expected that!

Overall very satisfied with this grinder. Highly recommend it, great piece for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loud but effective, hard to transfer to coffee pot
reviews.reviewText:
This product gets a 3 for three main reasons.
1. It's super loud while grinding which can be tough if people are still sleeping when you're using it
2. Lots of grounds stay stuck in it if you like a finer grind
3. It's not easy to pour the grounds into the basket on top of the coffee pot.

It does grind them very evenly and well though.

reviews.reviewTitle: More than just a coffee grinder!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as a coffee grinder for a gift. When it came in I read that you can use it to grind spices and other things too. I don’t drink coffee myself but I love to cook and this would be perfect to grind my spices. It is funny how things you need show up when you least expect them. 2 perfect gifts for 2 totally different reasons.

I use it to grind spices and it is fast! They have to be very dry though as it can get gummy with any moisture. Also, it is better to grind a decent amount because it tends to spin the smaller quantities instead of grinding. The top makes a good seal and it will pretty much powder anything I've put in it so leave the lid on for a minute for the particles to settle. I popped the lid right after grinding the first time and got a plume of lavender dust in the kisser. An easy trick to cleaning it was to drop a small handful of dried rice in and grind for a few seconds. Good purchase and delivered fast.

The grind is very inconsistent. A third of the beans are hardly broken up at all, a third are properly ground, and a third turn to dust completely. Now I have sludge in my French press. Pretty terrible, does not do what is promised. Would not recommend.

I received this product less than a week ago. So far I've used it about 10 times to grind up spices and it's been fantastic! It grinds them easily. A must for Indian cuisine. Cannot speak for the durability yet, but they have a very good warranty! Customer satisfaction is key and they are doing a good job.

The inside container is not stainless steel but aluminum. The day is known as stainless,
Aluminum Container Coffee grinder has never been used and I have to return it.
This grinder literally caught on fire after two uses!! The entire bottom turned red and smoke started coming out. Now it won’t even turn on. Disappointed as the reviews all looked promising!

I have never had an electric grinder of any sort, so I have nothing to compare. I got this to grind grain and seeds for different spices I am making. So far, I used it to grind up barley so I can make a breakfast dish with ground barley and fruit. It works perfectly! It is also small enough to travel with as well.

This coffee grinder is a great value. The cup holds enough beans for eight cups of coffee. I have been using it a month and have had perfect grounds each time. If there is any drawback it would be you have to jogglevthe cover to connect it to the base. A very minor flaw. I think it is a terrific value.

This handy dandy grinder has saved me a ton of money overall because rather than buying fancy coffee out daily, I grind my own beans & make coffee at home. It’s super easy to use; plug, add beans, grind, & dump. It’s a nice enough grinder I leave it on my counter & it looks nice next to my coffee pot.

This is an awesome little grinder. I have made multiple nut butters in it, ground chia seed and flax seed as well as made my own sweet potato flour in it. The only issue I have with it is cleaning it, getting under the blade is an issue without taking the thing apart.

I am in love with this coffee grinder. It’s small but so convenient. I was not sure of the reviews but I must say you won’t regret buying this grinder. It grinds the coffee beans very quickly. You won’t regret buying this product. Definitely a Christmas gift for my coffee loving family.

I got this for the hubby to grind herbs and other kitchen ingredients. It does an excellent job grinding any ingredient you put in the machine. It’s very easy to clean and appears durable. It is nice and compact, doesn’t take up much room at all.
It grinds extremely well. I didn't expect it to be so easy. You just never know what your gonna get buying online. I am pleasantly surprised.

The lid and electronic switch are designed nicely and are easy engage. The cup portion where the grinding occurs is 100% stainless steel and the side walls have three vertical ridges that help stir up what ever is being grinder. I use it to grind coffee.

I bought this because of the claims that it is quiet and it definitely is! My 1 year old son, who cries at the sound of the blender and my old coffee grinder, doesn't seem to mind this grinder. Yay! It also works great. I like a fine ground and it does this very evenly in just a few seconds. Great buy!

This is a terrific little grinder. I don't use it for coffee. I like to make some of my own spice blends. With a little practice I can control the size of the grind to my liking. Also size of the grinder doesn't take up too much room for storage.

Like the other reviews it is small. However if you ignore the fill line and fill it to the top with whole beans it works fine. Nice smooth grind. It is a pain to remove the grinds but the cute little broom helps.

I've had this a few days and have used it three times. I like it, it's the right size so it doesn't take up a lot of room in my small kitchen. It does a good job of grinding the beans and looks good. The card that came with it says it's got a lifetime guarantee. Quality product.

I purchased this particular bean grinder because it can also grind other things, like nuts. It works as expected. I gave this three stars for "easy to clean" because I don't find ANY bean grinders easy to clean, not a flaw with this machine, but overall it's a winner.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Coffee Grinder For First Time User
reviews.reviewText: This is the first time I have used a electric coffee grinder , I previsously used a manual and that was alot of effort, This is a great machine I can ground a whole bag in about 5-6 minutes and it is very easy to clean and great value for the money.

Pros:
Cheap
Sleek
Quiet

Cons:
Uneven grind

Only gave it 4 stars, as this blade grinder grinds my beans too fine on the outside and too coarse in the center (10 second grind). I like everything else about it.

My previous grinder cut out on me and I was looking for a replacement this was small enough that it can be portable big enough to do the quantity I’m looking for and it rains it very homely I am Jordan Maryland with this product

reviews.reviewTitle: Powerful and small - one pot at a time
reviews.reviewText: Very nice for the price - grinds beans to desired consistency in about 10 seconds. Wish it had larger capacity (can really only grind enough for one pot at a time) Small and stores on the shelf easily. Does exactly what I want it to do...on the first try I accidentally held down the button for too long and it turned the beans to a fine dust! Any grinder that can do that has to be good :)

reviews.reviewTitle: Fresh beans are the way to go!
reviews.reviewText: Works amazing! I will not go without fresh ground coffee beans again, no more pre-ground ever again! This thing is great, grinds them down to the perfect consistency, and cleans out easily!

reviews.reviewTitle: Work great. Arrived faster than expected
reviews.reviewText:
I love it. It works great!
Simple machine that grinds things.

Pro tip: don't overdo it otherwise you'll make it too fine.

This grinder has a nice wide opening to feed spices into and out of. Motor seems to be good. But, very noisy. Unlike my Kitchenaid grinder, this makes a very high pitched noise like it wants to take off. If that doesn't bother you, it's a very good value for the money

So far this product has worked out great for me! I usually buy my coffee beans in bulk and grind enough for each work week. The grinder is quick and isn't as loud as I was expecting it to be. The cleaning brush it comes with is really handy and the break away power cable makes storage easy.

This grinder is great for coffee beans & flax seed but when I tried to ground nuts, they turned to dust. I pulsed it for a few seconds and I ended up with nut dust and large chunks. Not was I was hoping for but I do love it for the coffee & flax.

Have just used it once so far to break up caked spices and it worked great. Brush was nice for cleaning. Some have complained about the noise but it's a grinder for pete's sake. What do they expect! Not noisier than I expected.

This really is my 1st and only grinder. So dar its easy to use and just a breeze to clean especially with the minature broom (My term). Its not expensive, nicely made and good for a quick grind of coffee.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good gift for a coffee lover
reviews.reviewText: I have very little space available. This grinder isn’t huge and bulky taking up lots of space. It’s very easy to use. Simply press a button. Wipes clean easily.
at first I could smell an electrical smell but after a few dozen uses it stopped, I chalk it up to being new..... it's a little small but would be OK for most people

reviews.reviewTitle: Performs as expected- not the best grinder I’ve had
reviews.reviewText:
Works great. Gets the beans to grind up “fine” if you like your grounds that way.
The biggest complaints I have are that the reservoir is on the small side and you can’t take it apart to clean it.
I use it exclusively to grind flax seeds weekly with 1-2 second pulses until I get the consistency I want. I use a 1" paint brush to clean the cutting bowl.
I really like this product and it works well. The only drawback is the reservoir for the coffee beans is little small. BUT like I said it's great product and works really well.

reviews.reviewTitle: It was Broken in 4 months, Not Reliable!!
reviews.reviewText: The cap is very difficult to clean. The push button pops out once and I carefully put it back. The worst thing happened today - it is broken totally!!

This grinder does a great job. Fast grind. Smooth grind.
Only issue is the small hopper capacity. Have to grind 2 hoppers worth for my 14 cup coffee maker.

This is a great little coffee grinder. You can grind course or fine with just a few pulses and you're ready to brew! It takes up very little space and haven't had any issues. The lifetime warranty was what sold me on this one.

I like the grind it gives with coffee and spices
Cleaning not is easy. But for the money it is a great little machine and does exactly what I need so I had to take a few extra minutes clean no big deal.
This grinder is great! I use it to grind my coffee beans and it does a great job. Fast and easy! Got here on time and in good shape. It's small so it fits good on my little coffee bar. No complaints!
Like I said this little thing is small it does the job it will take you all day to grind your coffee. It is no 12 cup like the description says it is 1/2cup.
Well made. Easy to use. Included brush makes it easy to clean. I wish the capacity of the grinding area were larger. Otherwise, based on my usage so far, very good.
The grinder works well, the consistency of the ground coffee is good as long as you shake the grinder a bit during the process. Would like it better if it had a little more capacity.
This product is perfect for grinding up whole beans right before making coffee. Grinds about 5 standard scoops of whole beans at a time.
Amazing! Easy to use, easy to clean and almost dummy proof. Comes with a little guide to tell you how long to grind based on how you want the beans.

This was an inexpensive grinder so I thought I’d give it a try. It grinds whole beans very well and fast too. The only gripe I have is it doesn’t grind a lot at one time. Very easy to clean with the provided brush.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well for what I need it for!
reviews.reviewText: This coffee grinder matches what I need to make a perfect French press coffee at my 'coffee's corner. It is very easy to use. With just one press and boom, I have a perfect coarse coffee grounds.
I use it every day and its amazing. I bought this one after my expensive broke after 6 months. This one is way better.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use, not so easy to clean!
reviews.reviewText: Great grinder! Grinds coffee beans like a champ! I had to downgrade a star because you can't remove the inside for cleaning, so it's slightly a pain....but overall its fantastic!
Seems to work pretty well for grinding peppercorns.
I've only used this once so far, but it was speedy. The instructions said 5-10 seconds for course grind and it didn't even take that long. I would definitely recommend this coffee grinder.
Grinds great but I don't like the fact that the lid is not attached in any way. It should at least snap on or have some kind of resistance to the lid falling off. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
We especially like that the little grinder is easily disconnected from the AC plug, making emptying it into the coffee machine super easy.
Nice, small grinder for coffee and spices.. I haven't had it for very long . so haven't used it to grind up spices yet. Am looking forward to using it quite often!
We've used many grinders over the years. This one is by far the best. The detachable cord is a great idea for storage (it fits in the grinder). Cleaning is a breeze.
this is a great traditional grinder. I had a burr grinder before this and it was nothing but problems, It was jamming up. no problems at all with this
It's looks gorgeous. It's quiet enough that i don't disturb the household when I'm up early for work
I have only had it and used it for a few days but it works well and much quieter than my previous grinder. Time will tell how it holds up. so far so good
Compact and grinds well. I'm using it for spices so far.
Good coffee grinder for the money. Quick and easy. I use the included brush to scoop out all the coffee! Plan on using this a long time!
Didnt even work
We're using this to grind coffee. It works fast and thorough. There's no point in spending more money on another coffee grinder when this one fulfills the need perfectly.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does what i bought it for. Cant complain
reviews.reviewText: Works well and cant complain. Only use it for coffee at this time so i cannot add any of info.
Nice, sleek, pretty, clean little machine. Grinds coffee quickly and quietly. I love it.
Great for coffee beans. I have not cleaned this out yet. I have not used it enough. Grinds the coffee beans perfectly for us.

reviews.reviewTitle: Coffee grinder becomes a flaxseed grinder
reviews.reviewText: This grinder is very easy to use. I am using it to grind flaxseed, rather than coffee, and it works great.
Easy to use. Quickly grinds coffee fine. Easily empties coffee into filter with a few taps. Great value.

Such a pain to use. If you only brew about a four cup pot of coffee great. We make a 10 cup pot and it takes three fill, grind, dumb repeat . You have to take the little brush and get the coffee out. To much work for me before I’ve had my morning joe. Only good thing about this is the cord length !
I use it to grind oatmeal for my protein shakes and it's perfect. Sleek, modern, and effective
We use this every morning and it works great. There's nothing fancy to it, just very functional. We haven't had any problems.
Nice little unit. Simple design and easy to use. It is refreshing to find something that gets it just right.
I bought this to grind my own spices and seasonings. Works good for what I do with it!
Very easy to use. A bit hard to clean, but not impossible. Did a great job grinding coffee uniformly to the correct consistency.
This is the first grinder I've used for coffee and I think it works pretty well. It's very easy to use.
If you’re new to grinding your own coffee beans, this is a good beginner grinder. It’s super easy to use and grinds the beans within seconds. I use it to grind beans for cold and hot brew.

reviews.reviewTitle: Grinds but kind of messy and loud
reviews.reviewText: Super loud. On/off button doesn’t work properly and it’s quite messy. Other than that it does the job.
easy to grind coffee makes coffee as fine as you want

reviews.reviewTitle: Fresh grounds for the daily grind
reviews.reviewText: Great blender came with everything g but the coffee, hehehe
Nice and small, travels easily and easy to clean and use.
Much smaller than I was expecting, takes a long time to grind a pound of coffee
Love the taste of fresh ground coffee - one cup per day - so this is a great grinder for one cup servings. Great for a k-cup machine.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect! Works for coffee and seeds!
reviews.reviewText: Small, efficient, easy to clean and use. Works well with coffee and seeds like chia and flax.
Best dang coffee grinder EVER!

I did not realize how small the capacity is.
It does a good job grinding.
This grinder is simply easy to use, and is fast. It is something you can take with you travel wise. I love this machine so much I am willing to buy another one.
Gave this coffee bean grinder as a gift. Recipient seemed completely happy with this product.
Love it! I also like the fact you can use it for recipe ideas, like crushing oreo's for a topping on ice cream or cheesecake, nuts etc. Great buy! It's so compact!
Looks good and is very efficient. Grinds coffee quick.
As I expected. Good product
Got mine next day after ordering put it to the test I love this little machine I even got two of my coworkers to get one
This is a great gadget to have
Excellent
Para moler café
Very easy to use -
Does the job
Excellent Grinder
Good quality product
This is a really good grinder. It's powerful and grinds fast.
Grinds coffee beans fine but is smaller then I expected. You have to grand several batches to get a full pot of coffee.
button popped off and spring popped off fell apart piece of junk
So far, so good. The capacity is a little small for me - I use this machine to grind up the dry dog food my 15 yr old dog can't chew. She says, "Thanks."
Gr8
Quality
This a perfect little coffee grinder.
It works for what need. I even used it to grind cinnamon for baking and it works fine.
Super efficient, grinds fast, smooth and is easy to clean! Great value too!
Great for the price!
I really like the fact that the power cord is removable. It's compact, quieter than my last one. I use for coffee only.
Awesome ~
It works well but the basket if pretty small.
Love it
Great french roast!!
We are very satisfied with our purchase, the Veken coffee grinder, ginds it to perfection.
Nice size
This grinder broke on me after the 1st use. It no longer turns on.
Great for jus a couple of cups of coffee, which was good for me.
Just what I needed, a coffee grinder
Great value. Been using a few months with no issues.
Did not work, wouldn't even turn on!
Simple, fast and easy.
It is perfect for grinding just the right amount of coffee for my French Press Pot! Very Satisfied!
I had several coffee Grinders over the years this one is very nice very easy to use..grind to my liking
Happy with purchase.
Wonderful
Efficient, quite, and grinds well.
I bought this for coffee beans and grinding acorns. Good product!
WORKS GREAT....
No complaints

My motivation for buying was to grind seeds, nuts, and herbs. Most of the things I want to grind have a bit of moisture in them. As I discovered when I grind flax seeds where it is a small struggle to get the results out. I found that putting an equal amount of oatmeal made it a little easy to get the content out, but still cleaning to bowl out is a minor task. Before you buy, note the instruction sheets that come with the unit says, “Solids must contain no moisture”

And don’t think you can easily remove the bowl to clean it out and to make sure no moisture is seeping below the bowl. The “How to Remove the Blade” instructions clearly were written by someone who doesn’t normally write English. My one attempt resulted in my conclusion that removing the bowl would create a safety issue upon re-installing.

The Amazon description says, “Not just grinding coffee bean, our grinder can also grind spices, nuts, herbs, pepper, seeds, grains and more!” I suspect the reason some customers have complained about the motor burning out have a moisture issue. I mean, don’t even coffee beans have a bit of moisture in them. Well, I now know that most of the seeds, nuts, and herbs I want to grind have moisture in them. My next grinder will need to handle my produce better than this one.

I’ve used my new grinder for about 10 days and intend to keep using it. I wouldn’t recommend this grinder to my friends. Please note that the Amazon description includes this statement: “We are dedicated to providing the best after-sales service! Just try our products because we are confident that you will love them. If for any reason you don’t absolutely love them, send 1 simple email to us and we will refund your purchase price with no questions asked (In fact, you don't even have to return the grinder).”

They will soon get an email and I will be looking for a new grinder.
